alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 15 at 12:07PM CST until December 16 at 6:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, south winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Thursday. For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Damaging winds tonight could blow down trees and power lines causing power outages, possibly for a prolonged period of time. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Empty semi-trailers will run the risk of being blown over.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
